Title: Projecting Using Functions
DescriptionLines: The projected query fields can be further processed by using **JavaScript functions.**
These functions are executed on the server side.
Be aware their execution time does Not time out the query.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the projecting function
DescriptionLines: * Within a raw-query-string, define a _JavaScript function_ that processes the 'Employee' document and returns a new 'projected' object.
* The above _output_ function returns a projected object literal that is computed from the following functions:

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the RQL query
DescriptionLines: * Within the raw-query-string, define the `RQL query` that will be executed on the server.
* Use `select` and call the JavaScript function defined from the previous step.
* In the above RQL, a query is defined on the 'Employees' collection.
Note the _select_ usage so that returned results are structured according to the defined _output_ method.

Walkthroughs.Title: Set the query
DescriptionLines: * Pass the raw-query-string to the Session `RawQuery()` method.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * The 'rawQuery' variable only stores the query definition.
* The _projectedResults_ variable will hold the resulting matching entities.
The entities returned by the query will have the structure of the custom struct _EmployeeDetails_
* The output projected entities returned by the query are Not tracked by the Session,
as they are not full documents.
* Any change made to these entities will Not be sent to the server upon calling SaveChanges().
